newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico April CPI 1.08 pct - Banco de Mexico.
newsitem.headline: Mexico April CPI 1.08 pct - Banco de Mexico.

text.p: Mexico's consumer price index rose 1.08 percent in April from the month before after rising 1.24 percent in March, Banco de Mexico said.
The central bank added that the producer price index rose 0.70 percent in April from the month before, compared to rise of 0.97 percent in March.
A survey of 10 Mexican brokerages and research companies found expectations of a rise of 1.11 percent for April's CPI.
The central bank said that compared with the same month a year earlier the CPI was 22.33 percent higher, compared with 36.93 percent the year period before.
The accumulated inflation rate for the first four months of the year was 6.73 percent, compared with 11.43 percent in the same period a year earlier.

It said that the main causes of inflation during the month was an increase in prices of urban transport, automobiles, insurance, local telephone service, soft-drinks, LP gas, alcholol and restaurants.
It said that the basic basket of consumer goods rose 1.09 percent in April from the month before.

In April, the producer price index, excluding petroleum, was 0.70 percent higher than the same month a year earlier.
The central bank said that compared with the same month a year earlier the PPI was 18.35 percent higher, compared with 37.33 percent the year period before.
The accumulated increase for the first four months was 5.45 percent. In the first four months of 1996, the index rose an accumulated 11.27 percent, Banco de Mexico said.
